snippet: A statement eased fears in Japan, where officials had been under fire for what some say is an unfair attempt to bring down the yen’s value.
abstract: Group of 7 nations release statement pledging to allow foreign exchange markets determine the value of their currencies; statement eases fears in Japan, where officials have been under fire for what some say is an unfair attempt to bring down the yen's value in an effort to boost their economy.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and ANNIE LOWREY
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels and Annie Lowrey from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A statement eased fears in Japan, where officials had been under fire for what some say is an unfair attempt to bring down the yen’s value.

headline.main: Group of 7 Says It Will Let Market Decide Currency Values
